reviews.subject: Computer Science
reviews.review: Dr. Chen is an exceptional instructor. Her lectures are clear, engaging, and she always makes time for student questions. The assignments are challenging but fair.

reviews.subject: History
reviews.review: Prof. Johnson brings history to life with his storytelling approach. The workload can be heavy, but it's worth it for the depth of knowledge you gain.

reviews.subject: Biology
reviews.review: Dr. Williams is passionate about biology and it shows in every lecture. Her lab sessions are particularly well-organized and informative.

reviews.subject: Mathematics
reviews.review: Prof. Lee knows his subject well, but can sometimes struggle to explain complex concepts clearly. Office hours are helpful if you're struggling.

reviews.subject: Psychology
reviews.review: Dr. Green's lectures are fascinating and she often incorporates current research. The class discussions are thought-provoking and engaging.

reviews.subject: English Literature
reviews.review: Prof. Brown has a deep love for literature that's contagious. His essay assignments can be challenging, but they really improve your writing skills.

reviews.subject: Chemistry
reviews.review: Dr. Martinez seems knowledgeable, but her teaching style is confusing. The pace of the class is too fast and it's easy to fall behind.

reviews.subject: Political Science
reviews.review: Prof. Wilson encourages critical thinking and lively debates. His assignments are challenging but help you develop strong analytical skills.

reviews.subject: Physics
reviews.review: Dr. Petrova explains complex physics concepts in an understandable way. Her demonstrations in class really help visualize abstract ideas.

reviews.subject: Economics
reviews.review: Prof. Clark's lectures can be dry, but the content is solid. The textbook is essential for understanding the material fully.

reviews.subject: Sociology
reviews.review: Dr. Wright's class opened my eyes to many social issues. Her assignments encourage you to apply sociological concepts to real-world situations.

reviews.subject: Art History
reviews.review: Prof. Kim's passion for art is evident in every lecture. The virtual museum tours he organizes are a highlight of the course.

reviews.subject: Environmental Science
reviews.review: Dr. Rodriguez makes environmental science relevant and urgent. Her field trips provide valuable hands-on experience.

reviews.subject: Philosophy
reviews.review: Prof. Turner is clearly knowledgeable, but his lectures can be hard to follow. The reading list is extensive and challenging.

reviews.subject: Linguistics
reviews.review: Dr. Taylor's approach to linguistics is both scientific and fun. The group projects are particularly enjoyable and educational.

reviews.subject: Business Administration
reviews.review: Prof. Harris seems more focused on his research than teaching. Lectures often feel unprepared and the grading seems arbitrary.

reviews.subject: Anthropology
reviews.review: Dr. Garcia brings anthropology to life with her fieldwork stories. The course offers a perfect blend of theory and practical application.

reviews.subject: Mechanical Engineering
reviews.review: Prof. Smith has extensive industry experience which he brings to the classroom. The projects are challenging but prepare you well for real-world engineering.

reviews.subject: Neuroscience
reviews.review: Dr. Johnson is at the cutting edge of neuroscience research and her enthusiasm is infectious. The lab work is particularly illuminating.

reviews.subject: Music Theory
reviews.review: Prof. Brown is a talented musician, but his teaching can be inconsistent. Some concepts are explained well, while others are rushed through.
